applicable_ipc_sections.description: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

applicable_ipc_sections.description: Whoever causes the death of any person by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
applicable_ipc_sections.why_applicable: This section may apply if the death was caused by rash or negligent driving.
applicable_ipc_sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years or fine or both

applicable_ipc_sections.section_title: Rash driving or riding on a public way
applicable_ipc_sections.description: Whoever drives any vehicle, or rides, on any public way in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.
applicable_ipc_sections.why_applicable: This section applies to rash or negligent driving that endangers human life.
applicable_ipc_sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months or fine up to ₹1000 or both

applicable_ipc_sections.section_title: Motor Vehicle Act - Driving under influence
applicable_ipc_sections.description: Whoever, while driving a motor vehicle, has in his blood alcohol exceeding 30 mg per 100 ml of blood detected in a test by a breath analyzer shall be punishable.
applicable_ipc_sections.why_applicable: This section applies because the victim was drunk, and if the driver was also under influence, this would be applicable.
